channel.title: General category moved back
channel.description:
I don't have to have any pride in saying that I believe my original idea of moving general category to the bottom would help promote server development. From what I have noticed, it has made no difference, other than to stop a lot of the activity we originally had in the general boards. This wasn't my intention and, as a result, I've moved the general category back up to the top of the website. There may be a bit more shifting around as I get feedback from the staff and from all of you.
Thanks, Taharok

item.title: General category moved back
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:45, topic:467980”][quote author=RSPS Mirrors link=topic=584928.msg4158982#msg4158982 date=1352888915]
Maybe ask an admin to check your user permissions. edit: still your inbox is full.


[/quote]

My point was that he does have unlimited pms as per permissions go, but SMF has always had a buggy permissions system when it comes to private messages. This has been an issue for a long time.[/quote]sounds like something you need to work on fixing xD

Read full topic

item.title: General category moved back

Maybe ask an admin to check your user permissions. edit: still your inbox is full.


[/quote]
My point was that he does have unlimited pms as per permissions go, but SMF has always had a buggy permissions system when it comes to private messages. This has been an issue for a long time.[/quote]
Yes, was just a reply to his pm as I couldn’t pm him back. Well it’s not good if we cannot pm a member of staff, is it buggy beyond repair or does it take a bit of playing with?

Read full topic

item.title: General category moved back
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“RSPS Mirrors, post:42, topic:467980”]Maybe ask an admin to check your user permissions. edit: still your inbox is full.

[/quote]

My point was that he does have unlimited pms as per permissions go, but SMF has always had a buggy permissions system when it comes to private messages. This has been an issue for a long time.
